official-title.#text: To amend the Tribally Controlled Colleges and Universities Assistance Act of 1978 to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to waive certain eligibility requirements.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

short-title.#text: Tribally Controlled Colleges and Universities Assistance Act of 1978

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tribally Controlled Colleges and Universities Assistance Act of 1978/s:103

header.#text: Amendment to the Tribally Controlled Colleges and Universities Assistance Act of 1978

text.#text: by adding at the end the following new subsections:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may waive the eligibility requirements set forth in
for a period of not more than 7 years upon request by a tribally controlled college or university—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tribally Controlled Colleges and Universities Assistance Act of 1978/s:103/ss:a

text.#text: that has received assistance under this title for 10 consecutive years;
that is located on Indian lands;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 141 of the title 13, United States Code

text.#text: that is located in a county that has an Indian population that did not decrease by more than one percent during the interval between the two most recent decennial censuses of population under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: has determined that such a waiver will support higher education opportunities appropriate to the needs of Indians.
shall approve or deny an application for a waiver under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tribally Controlled Colleges and Universities Assistance Act of 1978/s:103/ss:b

internal-xref.#tail: within 30 days of receipt of such an application or such application shall be deemed to be approved.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2069 IH: Tribally Controlled Colleges and Universities Assistance Act of 1978
